quotes.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Well-being is realized by small steps but is truly no small thing.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little but the man who craves more that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive – to breathe to think to enjoy to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present without anxious dependence upon the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fate is the endless chain of causation whereby things are; the reason or formula by which the world goes on.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length but the excellence of the acting that matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than the loss of time for it’s irretrievable.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things are parts of one single system which is called nature; the individual life is good when it is in harmony with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Begin at once to live and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Steel your sensibilities so that life shall hurt you as little as possible.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: As is a tale so is life: not how long it is but how good it is is what matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you lay violent hands on me you’ll have my body but my mind will remain with Stilpo.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not death that a man should fear but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a good flow of life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Wealth is the slave of the wise. The master of the fool.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The avaricious man is like the barren sandy ground of the desert which sucks in all the rain and dews with greediness but yields no fruitful herbs or plants for the benefit of others.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason and against nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so we should listen more than we say.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: There is no genius without a touch of madness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nothing is more hostile to a firm grasp on knowledge than self-deception.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Time heals what reason cannot.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is that we may listen the more and talk the less.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: You act like mortals in all that you fear and like immortals in all that you desire.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fate is the endless chain of causation whereby things are; the reason or formula by which the world goes on.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All the good are friends of one another.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars and see yourself running with them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Well-being is attained by little and little and nevertheless is no little thing itself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things are parts of one single system, which is called nature; the individual life is good when it is in harmony with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms—you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No matter whether you claim a slave by purchase or capture, the title is bad. They who claim to own their fellow men look down into the pit and forget the justice that should rule the world.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Silence is a lesson learned from the many sufferings of life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not events that disturb people, it is their judgments concerning them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We should make our life, not throw it away.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The highest virtue is to subdue the mind and discipline one’s desires.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He suffers more than necessary who suffers before it is necessary.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not the actions of others which trouble us, but rather it is our own response.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True good fortune is what you make for yourself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A good character is the only guarantee of everlasting, carefree happiness.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is better to conquer our grief than to deceive it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best answer to anger is silence.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Don’t go on discussing what a good person should be. Just be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Confine yourself to the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The greatest obstacle to living is expectancy, which hangs upon tomorrow and loses today.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You always own the option of having no opinion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a virtue, not pleasure.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Live according to nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Leisure without books is death and burial of a man alive.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man’s worth is no greater than his ambitions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Everything that happens happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Better to starve free than be a fat slave.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a horse; you cannot harness it.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who has self-conquest has fortitude.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is no greater evil than slavery.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: They lose the day in expectation of the night, and the night in fear of the dawn.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nature gave us one tongue and two ears so that we may listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things are parts of one single system, which is called nature; the individual life is good when it is in harmony with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: You cease to fear if you cease to hope.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man should bear in mind and ponder over the fact that he is an integral part of a system—the universe—and that he is bound by the ties of birth to his fellow men.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Every night before going to sleep, we must ask ourselves: What weakness did I overcome today? What virtue did I acquire?
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Fire tests gold; suffering tests brave men.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: By silence, I hear other men's imperfections and conceal my own.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is more civilized to make fun of life than to bewail it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You are a little soul carrying a corpse.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We should make our life, not throw it away.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: We should always be asking ourselves: ‘Is this something that is or is not in my control?’
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Live out your life in truth and justice.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fortify yourself with contentment, for this is an impregnable fortress.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a horse; you cannot harness it.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Life, if well lived, is long enough.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do not despise death, but be well content with it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is no need to care for the body, only to keep it alive for the soul.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of men’s desires, but by the removal of desire.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a virtue, not pleasure.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: We must indulge the mind and from time to time allow it the leisure which is its food and strength.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True good fortune is what you make for yourself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The wise man will always be found in social life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: One must not tie a ship to a single anchor, nor life to a single hope.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who fears death either fears the loss of sensation or a different kind of sensation. But if we shall have no sensation, we shall have no harm.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man should bear in mind and ponder over the fact that he is an integral part of a system—the universe—and that he is bound by the ties of birth to his fellow men.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Look to the essence of a thing, whether it be a point of doctrine, of practice, or of interpretation.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is no greater evil than slavery.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He who is brave is free.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a horse; you cannot harness it.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who follows reason in all things is both tranquil and active at the same time, and also cheerful and collected.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much. The life we receive is not short but we make it so; we are not ill provided but use what we have wastefully.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The universe is transformation; life is opinion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future too.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is that we may listen the more and talk the less.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It does not matter how many books you have, but how good the books are which you have.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you lay violent hands on me, you’ll have my body, but my mind will remain with Stilpo.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Let us say what we feel and feel what we say; let speech harmonize with life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The happiness of those who want to be popular depends on others; the happiness of those who seek pleasure fluctuates with moods outside their control; but the happiness of the wise grows out of their own free acts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things are parts of one single system, which is called nature; the individual life is good when it is in harmony with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: What really ruins our character is the fact that none of us looks back over his life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man's true delight is to do the things he was made for.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The avaricious man is like the barren sandy ground of the desert which sucks in all the rain and dews with greediness but yields no fruitful herbs or plants for the benefit of others.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Life, if you know how to use it, is long.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a good flow of life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No one is laughed at for falling down, but only for staying down.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How ridiculous and unrealistic is the man who is astonished at anything that happens in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The man who has anticipated the coming of troubles takes away their power when they arrive.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason and against nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: We should not, like sheep, follow the herd of creatures in front of us, making our way where others go, not where we ought to go.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is the person who continues in his self-deception and ignorance who is harmed.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The highest virtue is to subdue the mind and discipline one’s desires.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than the loss of time, for it’s irretrievable.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The day which we fear as our last is but the birthday of eternity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think or do. Only what you do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a virtue, not pleasure.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: We should every night call ourselves to an account: What infirmity have I mastered today? What passions opposed? What temptation resisted? What virtue acquired?
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks but only at what he does himself to make it just and holy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is that we may listen the more and talk the less.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The time will come when diligent research over long periods will bring to light things which now lie hidden. A single lifetime, even though entirely devoted to the sky, would not be enough for the investigation of so vast a subject.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Take full account of what your nature wants, and of what it avoids.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True good fortune is what you make for yourself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Life is long if you know how to use it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is better, of course, to know useless things than to know nothing.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not events that disturb people, it is their judgements concerning them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: A kingdom founded on injustice never lasts.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Remember upon waking that you will meet people who are discontented, dishonest, hostile, envious, and uncharitable.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is better to conquer our grief than to deceive it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Each day provides its own gifts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Death is the wish of some, the relief of many, and the end of all.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: All things are interconnected, and the web is holy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We should make our life, not throw it away.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Shall I tell you what philosophy holds out to humanity? Counsel.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To the wise, life is a tragedy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What progress, you ask, have I made? I have begun to be a friend to myself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of men's desires, but by the removal of desire.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Enjoy present pleasures in such a way as not to injure future ones.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: No one loses any other life than the one he now lives, nor does one live any other life than the one he will lose.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A good character is the only guarantee of everlasting, carefree happiness.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things are parts of one single system, which is called nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Be content to seem what you really are.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fortify yourself with contentment, for this is an impregnable fortress.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The greater part of progress is the desire to progress.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the last act of your life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: To want to know more than is sufficient is a kind of intemperance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: There is no need to care for the body, only to keep it alive for the soul.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events, and strong is its current; no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: To be brave is to be free.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A person's worth is measured by the worth of what he values.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who spares the wicked injures the good.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Be like the cliff against which the waves continually break; but it stands firm and tames the fury of the water around it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so we should listen more than we say.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: A great fortune is a great slavery.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Live according to nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: We become wiser by adversity; prosperity destroys our appreciation of the right.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Live out your life in truth and justice, tolerant of those who are neither true nor just.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: By silence, I hear other men's imperfections and conceal my own.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If you wish to be loved, love.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is no greater evil than slavery.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is the sign of a weak mind to be unable to bear wealth.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions—not outside.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No man is crushed by misfortune unless he has first been deceived by prosperity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If someone is able to show me that what I think or do is not right, I will happily change, for I seek the truth.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason and against nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is more fitting for a man to laugh at life than to lament over it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Choose not to be harmed—and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed—and you haven’t been.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Consider when you are enraged at any one, what you would probably think if he should die during the dispute.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what's left and live it properly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is that we may listen the more and talk the less.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He who has injured thee was either stronger or weaker. If weaker, spare him; if stronger, spare thyself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He who dreads hostility too much is unfit to rule.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is a virtue, not pleasure.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If virtue precede us, every step will be safe.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people but care more about their opinion than our own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fortify yourself with contentment, for this is an impregnable fortress.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Stop whatever you're doing for a moment and ask yourself: 'Am I afraid of death because I won't be able to do this anymore?'
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Better to starve free than be a fat slave.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Do everything as if it were the last thing you were doing in your life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nowhere you can go is more peaceful—more free of interruptions—than your own soul.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It's silly to try to escape other people's faults. They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do not be ashamed of help.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A good character is the only guarantee of everlasting, carefree happiness.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: True wealth is having little and wanting nothing.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To love only what happens; what was destined. No greater harmony.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who seeks wisdom is a wise man; he who thinks he has found it is mad.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: People look for retreats for themselves in the country, by the coast, or in the hills... There is nowhere that a person can find a more peaceful and trouble-free retreat than in his own mind... So constantly give yourself this retreat and renew yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fate is the endless chain of causation whereby things are.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is more civilized to make fun of life than to lament it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man’s worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The wise man will always be found in social life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Wealth is the slave of a wise man and the master of a fool.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Objective judgement, now, at this very moment. Unselfish action, now, at this very moment. Willing acceptance, now, of all external events. That’s all you need.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He who suffers before it is necessary suffers more than is necessary.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: When you wake up in the morning, tell yourself: The people I deal with today will be meddling, ungrateful, arrogant, dishonest, jealous, and surly. They are like this because they can’t tell good from evil.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of men's desires but by the removal of desire.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: The good things of prosperity are to be wished, but the good things that belong to adversity are to be admired.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True good fortune is what you make for yourself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The mind adapts and converts to its own purposes the obstacle to our acting. The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so we should listen more than we say.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you’re needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The only thing that isn’t worthless: to live this life out truthfully and rightly. And be patient with those who don’t.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He is most powerful who has power over himself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: There is no easy way from the earth to the stars.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature’s delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: While we wait for life, life passes.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: All the good are friends of one another.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Set aside a certain number of days during which you shall be content with the scantiest and cheapest fare, with coarse and rough dress, saying to yourself the while: 'Is this the condition that I feared?'
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fate is the endless chain of causation whereby things are.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: If you live in harmony with nature, you will never be poor; if you live according to what others think, you will never be rich.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Death smiles at us all; all we can do is smile back.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Consider that before long you will be nobody and nowhere, like all the things you see now and all the people now living.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than the loss of time.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No one can live happily who has regard to himself alone and transforms everything into a question of his own utility.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To live the good life: We have the potential for it. If we can learn to be indifferent to what makes no difference.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man should bear in mind and ponder over the fact that he is an integral part of a system.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: He who has great power should use it lightly.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Live according to nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: A sword never kills anybody; it is a tool in the killer’s hand.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nothing happens to anybody which he is not fitted by nature to bear.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We should make our life, not throw it away.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Things that were hard to bear are sweet to remember.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happiness is realized by small steps.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Fate is the endless chain of causation whereby things are.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium
